meanings.definition: To tighten or secure with a strap or rope.
meanings.sent1: She was chinching the backpack before the hike.
meanings.sent2: He always chinches his belt before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was chinching the acorn into its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully chinched the apron around his waist.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy chinched the reins tightly before riding off into the sunset.

meanings.definition: A small, tight fold or crease in fabric.
meanings.sent1: The tailor noticed a tiny chinching on the hem of the dress.
meanings.sent2: Her skirt had a delicate chinching along the waistline.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the chinching on the blanket, making it even smaller.
meanings.sent4: The paper had a neat chinching at the corner, showing attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: The old book had a worn chinching on the cover from years of use.

meanings.definition: The act of pulling or tightening something.
meanings.sent1: With a quick chinching, he secured the rope to the post.
meanings.sent2: The chinching of the drawstring kept the bag closed.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a sudden chinching of the cloth, revealing a hidden object.
meanings.sent4: The final chinching of the knot ensured the package wouldn't come undone.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the chinching echoed through the room as she adjusted the curtain rod.
